thread.title: Roy Keane SLAMS Arsenal and claims Gunners 'only have two decent players' after Bayern Munich drubbing

author: mirror.co.uk
title: Roy Keane SLAMS Arsenal and claims Gunners 'only have two decent players' after Bayern Munich drubbing

organizations.name: roy keane arsene wenger champions league bayern munich arsenal fc manchester united fc

text:
Roy Keane SLAMS Arsenal and claims Gunners 'only have two decent players' after Bayern Munich drubbing The former Manchester United midfielder almost saw no point in criticising Arsenal because the result was expected Share Comments By Thomas Bristow 23:31, 15 FEB 2017 Updated 23:33, 15 FEB 2017 Sport Video Loading Video Unavailable Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Watch this video again Video will play in Roy Keane slams Arsenal's 'average' squad Share this video Watch Next Share Comments Get Arsenal FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email Roy Keane has slammed Arsenal 's performance against Bayern Munich and claimed the Gunners 'only have two decent players'.
The former Manchester United midfielder was speaking on ITV's Champions League Highlights show after the north Londoner's suffered a humiliating 5-1 loss to the Bundesliga champions.
Arsene Wenger's side conceded four second half goals meaning they're all but certain to exit the Champions League at the last 16 stage for a seventh straight season.
After going one-nil down, thanks to a superb strike from Arjen Robben, Arsenal appeared to get themselves back into the game through Alexis Sanchez.
(Photo: Bongarts) The Chilean scored from a rebound after initially missing from the penalty spot.
But if the Gunners were motivated by heading into half-time at 1-1, it didn't show in the second 45.
Robert Lewandowski scored eight minutes after the restart, and Thiago made it 3-1 six minutes after that.
(Photo: Bongarts) The capitulation continued when the Spaniard doubled his tally seven minutes later and almost certainly ended the tie.
Substitute Thomas Muller then added insult to injury in the 88th minute by making it five.
"I'm not surprised," Keane said. "Did you think they'd go to Bayern Munich and get a result?
(Photo: David Price/Arsenal FC via Getty Images) "We've said it before, though. Lack of leaders, lack of characters, hunger, desire.
"But I have to say, tonight at this level, this stage of the competition, they're just not good enough.
"So there's no point in being too critical of them, because they're not good enough.
"They've only got two decent players. The rest, average."
Keane also hit out at stand-in captain Kieran Gibbs: "When I see Gibbs with the captain's armband on at the end of the game, you're in trouble."
